[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_delayed] [Delayed field handling] Does visit_delayed properly charge gas for DelayedFieldID references, or can attackers create many delayed fields to bypass gas limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_bool] [Boolean size] Is charging 40 abstract units for a boolean (line 302) excessive compared to its 1-byte actual size, causing unnecessary gas costs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_address] [Address size] Does the fixed cost of 40 units for AccountAddress properly reflect the 32-byte size, or could this mismatch cause gas calculation inconsistencies? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_struct] [Struct size calculation] Does visit_struct returning 'true' properly trigger recursive visitation of all fields, or can attackers create structs with unvisited fields to bypass gas charges? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_closure] [Closure gas metering] Does visit_closure account for captured environment size, or can attackers create closures with large captured contexts to bypass gas limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_vec] [Vector overhead] Is the fixed vector cost (40 units) sufficient for vector metadata regardless of element count, or should this scale with capacity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_vec_u8] [Feature version gate] The feature_version >= 3 check at line 338 adds vector overhead - can validators running version 2 and version 3 calculate different gas costs for the same transaction causing consensus failure? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/gas_schedule/misc.rs] [Function: visit_vec_u64] [Conditional overhead] Does the conditional addition of vector overhead based on feature_version create fork risks if validators upgrade asynchronously? (Critical)
